intro: Caralluma brownii, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white, blooming during the cooler hours of the day. Its leaves are thick and waxy, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration in hot, dry environments. Caralluma brownii is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
